title: Peanut Laddu 😋/ Dry Fruit Laddu 👌 || 2 Healthy Laddu(s) || Kids || Instant Laddu
content:
Sweet Recipe: Healthy Laddu : South India 🇮🇳 Laddu is a round shaped sweet recipe in India, they are served either in festive seasons/ occassions. Most of the special laddu's prepared with flour, sugar and combined with other ingredients next deep fried in oil and adds in sugar syrup. There are many sweet recipes originated from India like Boondi Laddu, Malai Laddu, Motichoor Laddu, Rava Laddu, Besan Laddu etc., types of Laddu varies from one state to another. I posted Besan Laddu on special festival Ganesh Chaturthi and other sweet recipes on Dussehra festival, you can check links at the end. Now a days, Kids lacking of healthy food so I prepared peanuts laddu and dry fruit Laddu which are rich in iron and calcium. They are simple to make and healthy Laddu(s) to taste which are loved by specially children/ kids. These laddu's are traditional in South India I have seen my grand mother used to prepare when we were kids, usually on every vacation we visited grand mother's home. Those days are lovely and cherished moments forever in my life ☺️ While packing lunch box to your kids, instead of chocolates or potato chips sometimes change their snack recipes by serving healthy laddu's either peanuts Laddu or dry fruit Laddu. It's best to explain them how is it useful to their health. You can checkout nutrition facts down below so it's easy to refer and inform to kids. It can be served in lunch time meal or at evening snack for kids. Today I prepared two sweet recipes but they are not made by sugar or flour. They are one Laddu prepared by peanuts and the other Laddu by dry fruits. Let's start with ingredients and follows Procedure Peanut Laddu: Servings: 12 laddu's Duration: 10-12 mins Ingredients:
  • Dry Roasted peanuts - 240 gms
  • Jaggery - 240 gms
Procedure:
  • Blend ground nuts and jaggery into smooth powder separately
  • Mix well on a plate
  • Make laddu's
  • Store in an airtight container
  • Preserve upto 2 weeks
Nutrition facts: Roasted peanuts: Vitamins B6 and also iron, calcium, potassium, magnesium, fiber & protein Jaggery: It contains iron, calcium, sodium & protein Step by step process shown below with pictures: [caption id="attachment_7565" align="alignnone" width="1020"] Peanut Laddu 😋[/caption] Dry Fruit Laddu: Servings: 8 Laddu's Duration: 10 mins Ingredients:
  • Dates - seedless - 12
  • Cashew nuts - 60 gms
  • Almonds - 60 gms
  • Pistachios - 60 gms
  • Poppy seeds - 1/2 tb sp
  • Ghee - 1/2 tb sp
Procedure:
  • Chop nuts & dates
  • Heat pan add ghee and roast chopped nuts
  • Roast 2 mins on medium heat
  • Next add ghee and roast poppy seeds for 1 min
  • Take out them on a plate
  • And also add chopped dates
  • Mix well & make ball
  • Divide into small parts and make laddu's
  • Store in an airtight container
  • Preserve upto 2 weeks
  • Enjoy cooking, have a nice day
Nutrition facts: Dates/ date Fruit : Vitamins C & B6 and also iron, calcium, potassium, magnesium, fiber & protein Dry fruits: Cashew nuts: Vitamins B6 and also iron, calcium, potassium, magnesium, fiber & protein Almonds: Vitamins and also iron, calcium, potassium, magnesium, fiber & protein Pistachios: Vitamins A,C & B6 and also iron, calcium, potassium, magnesium, fiber & protein Poppy seeds: It contains iron, calcium, potassium, magnesium, fiber & protein Step by step process shown below with pictures: [caption id="attachment_7564" align="alignnone" width="1020"] Dry Fruit Laddu 👌[/caption] Note:
  • Double the quantity to make more Laddu(s)
  • Contains peanuts
  • Instead of peanuts you can also use sesame seeds
  • Adjust sweetness according to taste
